meanings.sent1: The jacquerie in the village was a protest against the unfair treatment of the farmers.
meanings.sent2: The history book described the jacquerie as a significant event during medieval times.
meanings.sent3: The jacquerie at the market caused chaos as the peasants demanded better wages.
meanings.sent4: The jacquerie of angry villagers was like a storm brewing in the countryside.
meanings.sent5: The image of the jacquerie burning down the manor was etched in the minds of the nobles.

meanings.sent1: The jacquerie outside the stadium became rowdy and started breaking windows.
meanings.sent2: The police had to disperse the jacquerie that formed after the concert.
meanings.sent3: The jacquerie at the carnival was loud and unruly, causing a commotion.
meanings.sent4: The jacquerie of fans surged forward, eager to catch a glimpse of the celebrity.
meanings.sent5: The image of the jacquerie pushing and shoving reminded him of a stampede.
